title: 109_hr5413
content: The Act aims to improve the codification of title 46, United States Code, by incorporating public comments and amendments made after the cutoff date specified in a previous bill. It specifically addresses personal injury to or death of seamen. Section 30104 of title 46, United States Code is amended to allow seamen injured in the course of employment to bring an action under US laws for personal injury or death, similar to railway employees. The action can be in admiralty or as an action at law with trial by jury, and venue is determined by the plaintiff's choice. The plaintiff can choose to bring an action at law with a trial by jury, and venue will be in the judicial district where the employer resides or where their principal office is located. SEC. 3. AMENDMENTS TO CHAPTER 537. Amendments to title 46, United States Code include redesignating paragraphs, defining terms like Administrator and Secretary, and setting priorities for certain vessels. Amendments to title 46, United States Code prioritize certain vessels for guarantees under the Maritime Security Act of 2003. Amendments to title 46, United States Code prioritize vessels for guarantees under the Maritime Security Act of 2003. The Secretary of Defense determines eligibility for guarantee based on suitability for naval auxiliary service in war or national emergency and meeting sealift capacity shortfall within 30 days of request from the Administrator. Amendments to title 46, United States Code require the Administrator to determine vessel eligibility for guarantees under the Maritime Security Act within 30 days of a request. Various subsections are amended to include the Administrator in place of the Secretary of Transportation. Amendments to title 46, United States Code involve changing references from the Secretary of Transportation to the Administrator and specifying the timeline for vessel eligibility determinations under the Maritime Security Act. Amendments to title 46, United States Code include changing references from the Secretary of Transportation to the Administrator and specifying the timeline for vessel eligibility determinations under the Maritime Security Act. Subsections (b) and (c) are modified by removing "of Commerce" in headings and text. Subsection (d) now includes the option for a third-party independent analysis on financial structures. Amendments to title 46, United States Code involve changing references from the Secretary of Transportation to the Administrator and specifying vessel eligibility determinations under the Maritime Security Act. Subsection (d) now allows for third-party independent analysis on financial structures. Amendments to title 46, United States Code involve changes to financial structures and requirements for additional payments, collateral, or equity contributions in loan agreements. Amendments to title 46, United States Code involve changes to financial structures and requirements for additional payments, collateral, or equity contributions in loan agreements. The amendments include adjustments to various sections such as striking references to the Secretary of Commerce and Secretary of Transportation and replacing them with "Administrator" in specific provisions. Additionally, section 53732(e)(2) is modified to include "of Defense" after "Secretary" in the second instance. Amendments to title 46, United States Code involve changes to financial structures and requirements for additional payments, collateral, or equity contributions in loan agreements. Specific provisions are adjusted by replacing references to the Secretary of Commerce and Secretary of Transportation with "Administrator". Section 53732(e)(2) is modified to include "of Defense" after "Secretary" in the second instance. Amendments to title 46, United States Code involve changes to financial structures and requirements for additional payments, collateral, or equity contributions in loan agreements. Specific provisions are adjusted by replacing references to the Secretary of Commerce and Secretary of Transportation with "Administrator". The text is amended by inserting "or Administrator" after "Secretary" in various sections. Amendments to title 46, United States Code include changes to various sections such as 53709, 53710, 53711, 53712, 53713, 53714, 53715, 53716, 53721, 53722, 53724, and 53734. Sections 53715(d)(1), 53716(d)(3), 53721(c), 53722(a)(1) and (b)(1)(B), and 53724(b) are amended by adding "or Administrator's" after "Secretary's". SEC. 4. MISCELLANEOUS AMENDMENTS. Title 46, United States Code, is amended by changing "Naval Reserve" to "Navy Reserve" in chapters 513 and 515. Section 51504(f) is also amended to specify that the Secretary will pay for fuel costs for vessels used by State maritime academies for training. The payment amounts to State maritime academies are capped at $100,000 for fiscal year 2006, $200,000 for fiscal year 2007, and $300,000 for fiscal year 2008 and beyond. Section 51505(b)(2)(B) is amended to increase the payment cap to $300,000 for fiscal year 2006, $400,000 for fiscal year 2007, and $500,000 for fiscal year 2008 and beyond. Section 51701(a) is amended to include provisions for training vessels. The Secretary of Transportation may provide decorations, medals, and replacements as authorized by this chapter and prior laws. The Secretary of Transportation may provide decorations, medals, and replacements as authorized by this chapter and prior laws, including replacements for decorations and medals issued under a prior law. The Secretary of Transportation may provide decorations, medals, and replacements as authorized by this chapter and prior laws, including replacements for decorations and medals issued under a prior law. Chapter 541 - Miscellaneous is inserted after chapter 539 for provision of decorations, medals, and replacements. Section 54101 of title 46, United States Code, provides assistance for small shipyards and maritime communities. This section was transferred and redesignated from the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2006. The heading of section 54101 was also amended to reflect its purpose. Section 54101 of title 46, United States Code, provides assistance for small shipyards and maritime communities. It is amended to update certain provisions, including changes in section 55101(b) and section 60301 regarding tonnage fees for fiscal years 2006 through 2010. The amendment updates tonnage fees for fiscal years 2006 through 2010, with a limit of 22.5 cents per ton per year and 10 cents per ton per year thereafter. SEC. 5. REPEALS. The following provisions are repealed, except for rights, duties, penalties, or proceedings before the enactment of this Act. In 1936, Public Law 858, Section 1113 was enacted, related to U.S. Code 1279f. In 1936, Public Law 858, Section 1113 was enacted, related to U.S. Code 1279f. In 2006, on January 6, sections 109-163 and 515(g)(2) were added, along with sections 3502, 3507(a)-(c)(3), and (d) under U.S. Code 1271-1280, 1280b. In 2006, sections 3507(a)-(c)(3) and (d) were added under U.S. Code 1271-1280, 1280b, along with other sections. The Act will only be effective if H.R. 1442 in the 109th Congress is enacted, becoming effective immediately after its enactment.
